trans-unit.source: Provides a response from a Uniform Resource Identifier (URI).
This is an `abstract` class.
The <xref:System.Net.WebResponse> class is the `abstract` base class from which protocol-specific response classes are derived.

Applications can participate in request and response transactions in a protocol-agnostic manner using instances of the <xref:System.Net.WebResponse> class while protocol-specific classes derived from <xref:System.Net.WebResponse> carry out the details of the request.

Client applications do not create <xref:System.Net.WebResponse> objects directly; they are created by calling the <xref:System.Net.WebRequest.GetResponse%2A> method on a <xref:System.Net.WebRequest> instance.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Net.WebResponse"></xref> class.
Applications do not call the <xref:System.Net.WebResponse> constructor directly; use the <xref:System.Net.WebRequest.GetResponse%2A> method on a <xref:System.Net.WebRequest> instance.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Net.WebResponse"></xref> class from the specified instances of the <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> and <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext"></xref> classes.
When implemented by a descendant class, this constructor implements the <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.ISerializable> interface for the <xref:System.Net.WebResponse> descendant.

An instance of the <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> class that contains the information required to serialize the new <xref href="System.Net.WebRequest"></xref> instance.

An instance of the <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext"></xref> class that indicates the source of the serialized stream that is associated with the new <xref href="System.Net.WebRequest"></xref> instance.
Any attempt is made to access the constructor, when the constructor is not overridden in a descendant class.
When overridden by a descendant class, closes the response stream.

The <xref:System.Net.WebResponse.Close%2A> method cleans up the resources used by a <xref:System.Net.WebResponse> and closes the underlying stream by calling the <xref:System.IO.Stream.Close%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method.
The response must be closed to avoid running out of system resources.
The response stream can be closed by calling <xref:System.IO.Stream.Close%2A?displayProperty=fullName> or <xref:System.Net.WebResponse.Close%2A>.
The <xref:System.Net.WebResponse> class is an `abstract` class.
The actual behavior of <xref:System.Net.WebResponse> instances at run time is determined by the descendant class returned by <xref:System.Net.WebRequest.GetResponse%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
For more information about default values and exceptions, please see the documentation for the descendant classes, such as <xref:System.Net.HttpWebResponse> and <xref:System.Net.FileWebResponse>.
Any attempt is made to access the method, when the method is not overridden in a descendant class.
When overridden in a descendant class, gets or sets the content length of data being received.
The <xref:System.Net.WebResponse.ContentLength%2A> property contains the length, in bytes, of the response from the Internet resource.
For request methods that contain header information, the <xref:System.Net.WebResponse.ContentLength%2A> does not include the length of the header information.
The <xref:System.Net.WebResponse> class is an `abstract` class.
The actual behavior of <xref:System.Net.WebResponse> instances at run time is determined by the descendant class returned by <xref:System.Net.WebRequest.GetResponse%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
For more information about default values and exceptions, please see the documentation for the descendant classes, such as <xref:System.Net.HttpWebResponse> and <xref:System.Net.FileWebResponse>.
The number of bytes returned from the Internet resource.
Any attempt is made to get or set the property, when the property is not overridden in a descendant class.
When overridden in a derived class, gets or sets the content type of the data being received.
The <xref:System.Net.WebResponse.ContentType%2A> property contains the MIME content type of the response from the Internet resource, if known.
The <xref:System.Net.WebResponse> class is an `abstract` class.
The actual behavior of <xref:System.Net.WebResponse> instances at run time is determined by the descendant class returned by <xref:System.Net.WebRequest.GetResponse%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
For more information about default values and exceptions, please see the documentation for the descendant classes, such as <xref:System.Net.HttpWebResponse> and <xref:System.Net.FileWebResponse>.
A string that contains the content type of the response.
Any attempt is made to get or set the property, when the property is not overridden in a descendant class.
Releases the unmanaged resources used by the <xref href="System.Net.WebResponse"></xref> object.
Releases the unmanaged resources used by the <xref href="System.Net.WebResponse"></xref> object, and optionally disposes of the managed resources.
This method is called by the public `Dispose()` method and the <xref:System.Object.Finalize%2A> method.
`Dispose()` invokes the protected `Dispose(Boolean)` method with the `disposing` parameter set to `true`.
<xref:System.Object.Finalize%2A> invokes `Dispose` with `disposing` set to `false`.
When the `disposing` parameter is `true`, this method releases all resources held by any managed objects that this <xref:System.Net.WebResponse> references.
This method invokes the `Dispose()` method of each referenced object.
This member outputs trace information when you enable network tracing in your application.
For more information, see [Network Tracing in the .NET Framework](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md).
`true` to release both managed and unmanaged resources; `false` to releases only unmanaged resources.
Populates a <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> with the data that is needed to serialize the target object.
Any objects included in the <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo> are automatically tracked and serialized by the formatter.
The <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> to populate with data.
A <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext"></xref> that specifies the destination for this serialization.
When overridden in a descendant class, returns the data stream from the Internet resource.
The <xref:System.Net.WebResponse.GetResponseStream%2A> method returns the data stream from the Internet resource.
The response stream must be closed to avoid running out of system resources.
The response stream can be closed by calling <xref:System.IO.Stream.Close%2A?displayProperty=fullName> or <xref:System.Net.WebResponse.Close%2A>
An instance of the <xref href="System.IO.Stream"></xref> class for reading data from the Internet resource.
Any attempt is made to access the method, when the method is not overridden in a descendant class.
When overridden in a derived class, gets a collection of header name-value pairs associated with this request.
The <xref:System.Net.WebResponse.Headers%2A> property contains the name-value header pairs returned in the response.
The <xref:System.Net.WebResponse> class is an `abstract` class.
The actual behavior of <xref:System.Net.WebResponse> instances at run time is determined by the descendant class returned by <xref:System.Net.WebRequest.GetResponse%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
For more information about default values and exceptions, please see the documentation for the descendant classes, such as <xref:System.Net.HttpWebResponse> and <xref:System.Net.FileWebResponse>.
An instance of the <xref href="System.Net.WebHeaderCollection"></xref> class that contains header values associated with this response.
Any attempt is made to get or set the property, when the property is not overridden in a descendant class.
Gets a <xref href="System.Boolean"></xref> value that indicates whether this response was obtained from the cache.
The current cache policy and the presence of the requested resource in the cache determine whether a response can be retrieved from the cache.
Using cached responses usually improves application performance, but there is a risk that the response in the cache does not match the response on the server.
Use the <xref:System.Net.WebRequest.CachePolicy%2A> property to set and the <xref:System.Net.Cache.RequestCachePolicy> class to enumerate the current caching policy.
Note that getting this property can throw <xref:System.ObjectDisposedException>.
`true` if the response was taken from the cache; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a <xref href="System.Boolean"></xref> value that indicates whether mutual authentication occurred.

To request mutual authentication, set the <xref:System.Net.WebRequest.AuthenticationLevel%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property using the <xref:System.Net.Security.AuthenticationLevel.MutualAuthRequested> or <xref:System.Net.Security.AuthenticationLevel.MutualAuthRequired> enumeration value.

The default value for the <xref:System.Net.WebRequest.AuthenticationLevel%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property contains <xref:System.Security.Principal.TokenImpersonationLevel.Delegation> and <xref:System.Net.Security.AuthenticationLevel.MutualAuthRequested>.
Note that getting this property can throw <xref:System.ObjectDisposedException>.
`true` if both client and server were authenticated; otherwise, `false`.
When overridden in a derived class, gets the URI of the Internet resource that actually responded to the request.
The <xref:System.Net.WebResponse.ResponseUri%2A> property contains the URI of the Internet resource that actually provided the response data.
This resource might not be the originally requested URI if the underlying protocol allows redirection of the request.
The <xref:System.Net.WebResponse> class is an `abstract` class.
The actual behavior of <xref:System.Net.WebResponse> instances at run time is determined by the descendant class returned by <xref:System.Net.WebRequest.GetResponse%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
For more information about default values and exceptions, please see the documentation for the descendant classes, such as <xref:System.Net.HttpWebResponse> and <xref:System.Net.FileWebResponse>.
An instance of the <xref href="System.Uri"></xref> class that contains the URI of the Internet resource that actually responded to the request.
Any attempt is made to get or set the property, when the property is not overridden in a descendant class.
Gets a value that indicates if headers are supported.
This property is always true for [!INCLUDE[net_v45](~/includes/net-v45-md.md)].
Returns <xref href="System.Boolean"></xref>.
`true` if headers are supported; otherwise, `false`.
Populates a <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> instance with the data that is needed to serialize <xref href="System.Net.WebResponse"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> that will hold the serialized data for the <xref href="System.Net.WebResponse"></xref>.

A <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext"></xref> that contains the destination of the serialized stream that is associated with the new <xref href="System.Net.WebResponse"></xref>.
